reference_template: Author, A. A., & Author, B. B. (Year). Title of article. *Title of Journal, volume*(issue), pages. https://doi.org/xxxxx
template_explanation: Academic databases provide access to scholarly articles. Citations should follow the format of the underlying source type (usually journal articles), including authors, publication year, article title, journal information, and DOI when available.
common_rules: Cite the original publication, not the database itself
Include DOI when available from the database
Use journal article format for articles found in databases
Include database name only when no DOI is available
List up to 20 authors with last name, initials
Article title in sentence case (not italicized)
Journal name in title case and italicized
key_validation_points: & before last author in reference list
Journal name title case and italicized
DOI formatted as URL when available
Database name included only when no DOI
